[[File:Book of the Foxrook manuscript pa: The '''Book of the Foxrook''' is a manuscript by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], likely composed around [[10 June]] [[1909]] (this date was added to the title-page).<ref>{{CG

It consists of a 16-page notebook containing "''the key to a secret code consisting of a rune-like phonetic alphabet and a sizable number of ideographic symbols''".<ref name=Seven/> The invented script is called ''Privata Kodo Skauta'' ("Private Scout Code").<ref>{{webcite
column7: accessed=27 December 2016}}</ref> The book also contains comments on [[Wikipedia:Esperanto
column8: Esperanto]].<ref name=Seven>[[Arden R. Smith]], [[Patrick H. Wynne

[[File:Book of the Foxrook manuscript pa: The existence of this manuscript was apparently first mentioned by [[Humphrey Carpenter]] in his ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography]]'' (p. 37).<ref name=Seven/> A page from the Book of the Foxrook was reproduced in the exhibition catalogue ''[[Tolkien: Life and Legend]]''. An analysis and transcription of the same page appeared in the article "Tolkien and Esperanto" (cf. pp. 29-34), published in [[SEVEN 17
The Book of the Foxrook is kept at the [[Bodleian Library]] (Family papers 1/29(3), fol. 1r).<ref name=Seven/>
